page.title: 17Railway Anniversary
page.content: Mr Finch told us he went to Bristol on Saturday by{HS125}to celebrate one of his heroes, engineer Isombard{Brunel} who built fine bridges, stations and ships for the{Great Western Railway,} begun with broad guage in 1835. From the 'railway cathedral'{(Paddington) the line is very level, through Goring Gap in the Chilterns, across the Vale of the White Horse to Box tunnel; they say this is designed so sunrise shines right through on Brunel's{birthday. From Bristol, America was reached with ships like{SS Great Britain,}(world's first, screw-driven with steel hull); Mr Finch saw her in the '70s coming under{Clifton suspension bridge}on a pontoon after years languishing in the Falklands - now she has been restored. {Temple Meads}station is like a castle; here they had a dinner, with 'strawbs' and cream, and 150th birthday cake.
